SENT.plain: Cerebrovascular accidents due to Moyamoya disease, a disorder characterized by arterial stenosis at the base of the brain accompanied by typical net-like collateral vessels, occurred in two young Japanese women with Graves' disease when they were in thyrotoxicosis
In one patient, a second attack of cerebral infarction occurred with the recurrence of thyrotoxicosis
Association of Moyamoya disease and Graves' thyrotoxicosis is rare and the pathegenetic relationship is discussed
